questions.prompt: In BG 1.1, Dhritarashtra specifically asks Sanjaya what the assembled parties did at which place?
questions.feedback: Dhritarashtra asks about the battle assembly at Kurukshetra, described as a place of pilgrimage (dharma-ksetra).

questions.prompt: According to the purport of BG 1.1, how should Bhagavad-gita be studied to avoid error?
choices: By reading only the Sanskrit meter
By scrutinizing it with the help of a devotee in disciplic succession
By ignoring Arjuna's role as a student
questions.feedback: The purport advises reading Bhagavad-gita very scrutinizingly with the help of a devotee, without motivated interpretations.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.2, after viewing the Pandava army formation, Duryodhana approaches whom first?
questions.feedback: Sanjaya says Duryodhana went to his teacher after seeing the Pandava army arranged in formation.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.3, Duryodhana praises the Pandava army as being expertly arranged by whose disciple?
questions.feedback: He notes the army is expertly arranged by the intelligent disciple, the son of Drupada.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.4, which trio is specifically named as heroic bowmen equal in fighting to Bhima and Arjuna?
questions.feedback: BG 1.4 names Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada among those equal to Bhima and Arjuna.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.5, which of the following is listed among the heroic fighters on the Pandava side?
questions.feedback: BG 1.5 lists Kuntibhoja (along with several others) as a great heroic fighter.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.7, Duryodhana begins listing the captains especially qualified to lead whose force?
questions.feedback: He says he will tell about captains qualified to lead 'my military force'.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.8, Duryodhana lists the 'always-victorious' warriors. Whom does he mention first?
questions.feedback: Correct: Duryodhana begins the list with 'bhavan' ('yourself'), addressing Dronacarya directly. Only after that does he name Bhishma, Karna, and others.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.10, Duryodhana describes the Kaurava strength as _____ and the Pandava strength as _____.
questions.feedback: He says their strength is immeasurable under Bhishma, whereas the Pandavas' strength is limited under Bhima.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.11, what does Duryodhana ask his warriors to do in relation to Bhishma?
choices: Give him full support at strategic points
Send him away from the phalanx
questions.feedback: Duryodhana asks everyone to give full support to Bhishma at their strategic entrances.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.12, Bhishma blows his conchshell loudly, making a sound like what, and it gives Duryodhana what?
choices: A roar of a lion; joy
questions.feedback: Bhishma's conch sounds like a lion's roar and gives Duryodhana joy.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.14, whose chariot is described as being drawn by white horses?
questions.feedback: BG 1.14 describes Krishna and Arjuna on a great chariot drawn by white horses.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.15, which conchshell is blown by Lord Krishna?
questions.feedback: Krishna blows Pancajanya; Arjuna blows Devadatta; Bhima blows Paundra.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.15, what is the name of Arjuna's conchshell?
questions.feedback: BG 1.15 states Arjuna blew his conchshell named Devadatta.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.16-18, which pair of brothers blow the conchshells Sughosha and Manipuspaka?
questions.feedback: BG 1.16-18 says Nakula and Sahadeva blew Sughosha and Manipuspaka.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.19, what effect does the uproarious conchshell sound have on the sons of Dhritarashtra?
choices: It makes them abandon the battlefield immediately
questions.feedback: BG 1.19 says the sound shattered the hearts of the sons of Dhritarashtra.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.20, Arjuna's chariot bears a flag marked with which figure?
questions.feedback: BG 1.20 mentions the flag marked with Hanuman.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.21-22, why does Arjuna ask Krishna to place the chariot between the two armies?
choices: To see who is present and with whom he must contend
questions.feedback: Arjuna asks to see those assembled and with whom he must fight in this trial of arms.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.23, Arjuna says the opposing side is trying to please whom?
questions.feedback: He says they came to fight wishing to please the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.25, Krishna tells Arjuna to behold all the _____ assembled there.
questions.feedback: Krishna says, 'Just behold, Partha, all the Kurus assembled here.'

questions.prompt: In BG 1.27, after seeing relatives and friends, Arjuna becomes overwhelmed with what?
questions.feedback: BG 1.27 says Arjuna became overwhelmed with compassion.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.28-29, which pair of symptoms does Arjuna mention first?
choices: Limbs quivering and mouth drying up
questions.feedback: Arjuna says his limbs are quivering and his mouth is drying up.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.30, what happens to Arjuna's bow Gandiva?
questions.feedback: BG 1.30 states Gandiva is slipping from Arjuna's hand.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.31-32, Arjuna says he does not desire victory, kingdom, or happiness if it comes by what?
questions.feedback: He says he does not want victory, kingdom, or happiness at the cost of killing his relatives.

questions.prompt: In BG 1.47, what does Arjuna do at the end of the chapter?
choices: He blows his conchshell and attacks
He sits down on the chariot, casting aside his bow and arrows
questions.feedback: BG 1.47 concludes with Arjuna sitting down on the chariot and casting aside his bow and arrows.
